metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7966 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Through a malicious URL that contained a quote character it was possible to inject HTML code in KMail's plaintext viewer. Due to the parser used on the URL it was not possible to include the equal sign (=) or a space into the injected HTML, which greatly reduces the available HTML functionality. Although it is possible to include an HTML comment indicator to hide content.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7966` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkf5coreaddons-data - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
libkf5coreaddons5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per ScottK: Affected package is kdepimlibs in 12.04 - 15.04 and it looks like both kcoreaddons and messagecomposer in later releases tsimonq2> An additional part to this was released, therefore we need additional commits on top of the initial fix.

criterions.comment: kcoreaddons package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1').
